# Mage Armor (Spell)
## Overview
[[Conjuration Spells|Conjuration]] ([[Creation Spells|creation]]) \[[[Force Spells|force]]]

**Level:** [[1st Level Sorcerer Spells|Sorcerer 1]], [[1st Level Summoner Spells|Summoner 1]], [[1st Level Wizard Spells|Wizard 1]]

**BoXM:** [[BoXM 1st-Level Wizard Spells List|Wizard 1]]

**Casting Time:** 1 standard action

**Components:** V, S, F (a piece of cured leather)

**Range:** Touch

**Target:** Creature touched

**Duration:** 1 hour/level (D)

**Saving Throw:** Will negates (harmless)

**Spell Resistance:** No

**Source:** PF Core Rulebook, pg. 306

An invisible but tangible field of force surrounds the subject of a *mage armor* spell, providing a +4 armor bonus to AC.

Unlike mundane armor, *mage armor* entails no armor check penalty, arcane spell failure chance, or speed reduction. Since *mage armor* is made of force, incorporeal creatures canâ€™t bypass it the way they do normal armor.
